summary.overview: Wales has three skydiving dropzones offering spectacular coastal and mountain views. Two are currently operating (Swansea and Haverfordwest) with Snowdonia temporarily closed pending Chief Instructor appointment.
summary.bestFor: Coastal views (Swansea, Haverfordwest) or mountain scenery (Snowdonia when operational)

operators.name: Skydive Swansea (GoSkydive)
operators.uniqueSellingPoint: Highest jumps in Wales (15,000ft), part of UK's leading operator GoSkydive
operators.bestFor: Maximum freefall time, established reputation, coastal views

operators.name: Skyline Skydiving Haverfordwest
operators.views: Pembrokeshire Coast National Park, St Brides Bay
operators.uniqueSellingPoint: Most affordable option, only dropzone in West Wales, Pembrokeshire Coast views
operators.bestFor: Budget-conscious jumpers, Pembrokeshire tourists, coastal scenery

operators.name: Skydiving Wales (Snowdonia)
operators.statusReason: Awaiting Chief Instructor appointment (British Skydiving requirement)
operators.views: Mount Snowdon, Snowdonia National Park, Cardigan Bay
operators.uniqueSellingPoint: JUMP ABOVE MOUNT SNOWDON - most scenic skydive in UK
operators.bestFor: Scenic mountain views, Snowdonia tourists, photography
operators.futureProspects: May reopen when Chief Instructor position filled

southWales.characteristics: Coastal jumping, highest altitude available, easy access from M4

westWales.characteristics: Most affordable, Pembrokeshire coastline, island views

northWales.characteristics: Mountain scenery, jumping above Snowdon, 360° views

charityJumps.description: Raise money for charity, jump for free

affCourses.description: Accelerated Freefall - learn to skydive solo

age.under18: Requires parental consent and witnessed medical form

weight.surcharges: £10-£30 for weights over 15 stone at some centres

requirements.whatToWear: Comfortable clothes, trainers/boots, warm layers for altitude

bestTimeOfYear.peak: June - August (best weather, longest days, books up fast)
bestTimeOfYear.weather: All skydiving is weather-dependent - be flexible with dates

videoPackages.recommendation: Highly recommended - it's a once-in-a-lifetime experience worth capturing

swansea.primary: Gower Peninsula - golden beaches and coastal cliffs
swansea.secondary: Bristol Channel, Mumbles, Three Cliffs Bay

haverfordwest.secondary: St Brides Bay, Skomer Island, Irish Sea

snowdonia.primary: Mount Snowdon (you jump ABOVE it at 3,560ft)
snowdonia.secondary: Snowdonia National Park, Cardigan Bay, Llŷn Peninsula
snowdonia.note: 360° panoramic mountain views - considered UK's most scenic skydive
